Description: Fragment of lid of East Greek pottery vase; on underside sets of concentric lines in tondo, glazed outside; on top, band of dots between lines around (lost) knob; frieze with lion to right, with a few possibly intentional incised lines; white for the neck and ribs of lion. The paint is thin and streaky, fired to reddish-brown (2.5 YR 4/4).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit notes that the drawing style, as the added white at the ribs (also seen on Alexandria 17197), is unusual.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 54, no. 189 pl. 44)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.399)
